Topic.Title: Big Tech Is Struggling With Old Age. Great Fortune Article.

Message.Msg: I'm old and tired. I do 100lb reps 12 times. Swim sevarl laps and do 25 puchups. I'm old and tired. IBM is old and tired. But still kicking and showing profits yoy. WE collect dividends here and watch as the stock progresses up and up. Why don't you join us for the ride? Even if you short the stock you will be a contributor to our overall long term profits.

zer0t0l - No. I think you should stay in. Not a single sentence that I wrote mentioned what I think anyone else should do. I just said that I'm glad to be completely out and I gave a few reasons. You should do whatever you want - that's what makes a market. I'm not long or short IBM - just out.

Treasury stock is a contra equity that offsets common stock. It reduces stockholders' equity. Eventually the company will sell some (or all) of the stock it owns. It's certainly not advantageous to have the value collapse.

By the way - You misunderstand the term "retired." My birthday is June 1970. That might seem old to you but I think "grampa" is a little extreme. I suppose if you really wanted to, you could do a little homework and figure out exactly who I actually am. Let me know when you have a name.

"I suppose if you really wanted to, you could do a little homework and figure out exactly who I actually am. Let me know when you have a name." That's easy -- you are the famous " poop for brains" who flames the stock. Ask me anything...
Are you grandma ? Grandma I have been hoping I would run into you on the IBM Message Board. How is Grandpa. ? What a small world. Good writing to you Grandma.

Topic.Title: Big Tech Is Struggling With Old Age. Great Fortune Article.

Message.Msg: One of the best posts I have seen on this forum in some time. Definitely agree with the "bottom-up driven internally" comment. There are definitely concerns with any company, but IBM has a lot of positives that can not be overlooked.

This question has come up for years. I respond with the same answer over and over again. It won't happen. With that said, I do agree that if Dividend splits start to occur again with other companies for whatever "emotional reason", that the post below does have merit. If IBM meets its 2015 earnings of at least $20 a share, then possibly at that time (2016) a Dividend split might occur.

Message.Title: Last Tuesday in April
Message.Msg: .....that is when they announce the dividend increase for the next year. A dime bump to 95 cents fits with recent increases. But maybe they will jump 15 cents to a buck to hit a round number and make a statement. They can easily afford it - they are only paying out about 20percent of earnings.

Topic.Title: Big Tech Is Struggling With Old Age. Great Fortune Article.

Message.Msg: Thanks for posting your April excercise routine. Now share with the board what May's workout routine consists of. I can't believe you do all of that in one month. Good for you.

" But maybe they will jump 15 cents to a buck to hit a round number and make a statement. They can easily afford it - they are only paying out about 20percent of earnings." IBM has shown that they don't intend to go over 25% on an initial ttm ratio of divvy / EPS. My hope is that they ease into 25% as a cap on ttm Operating EPS. But the key is that they don't seem to want to risk going to 25% so it's probably more like 23%. If they take it up $.40 to $3.80 or up $.45 to $3.85 that is about 23% of $16.70. So my guess is $3.85 max.

Message.Title: IBM is the Tech Acquirer of Choice
Message.Msg: Since HPQ and DELL are both struggling. Even if it's a cash offer to buy the start-up, the future of the technology you are selling in your company may also be very important to you. If IBM buys your company on the basis of integrating the technology it means future jobs for the start up entrepreneurs and the staff that got them there. If a start-up has a chance to sell to or sell through IBM, or get to look at a purchase offer that includes future plans for the technology and staff they may take it because IBM is the safer bet. DELL or HPQ could see big corporate disruptions in the near term like parts sold off at fire sale prices so for senior start-up staff who stay employed with the acquiring company you have to wonder about future stock options you might receive as an employee of HPQ, DELL or IBM.

Topic.Title: Big Tech Is Struggling With Old Age. Great Fortune Article.

Message.Msg: banmate7, totally agree with your post, especially shedding a lot of the useless middle management "project management" types who do nothing but make presentations and get status from others. IBM used to form small technical groups and let them tackle big problems on their own, and those are wildly successful and the perfect thing to attract young talent. I was lucky enough to be part of those teams twice and the work morale and rewards were fantastic. IBM could do this and shed even more salary currently going to the people who do nothing but push papers and talk big.
Agreed, $3.80 is probably where it will end up. Sure $4.00 would be nice, but that will be next year most likely.

Message.Title: IBM Gap Up over the next four trading days - enjoy!
IBM CEO is in panic mode yells st employees to move faster. LOL
